job_title: Manager of Training and Development in Tallahassee, FL
pros: I am so privileged to work at BBH. I moved my family from Ga for this job. The culture and the people are so compassionate and encouraging. We take excellent care of our patients, but we make sure that we are taking good care of each other. Professor development and staff support are essential to the growth of our organization.
cons: The only con I can honestly say is managing our growth and changes can be challenging at times.

pros: Flexibility and freedom of schedule, autonomy, working with patients, bonuses, coworkers
cons: Long IDT meetings, pay could be better for the work you do, lack of community resources

pros: Good salary Great colleagues Good benefits Lots of PTO time

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Tallahassee, FL
pros: Autonomy, autonomy, autonomy, autonomy, and autonomy

great social service team
caring and empathetic supervisor
building relationships with patients and families
make your own schedule
flexibility
holiday bonus
cons:
insurance premiums too high
short staffed
salary is decent, but not nearly enough for the hard work you put in

pros:
Everyone in management cares about the employees under them and wants them to achieve their passions and dreams. 

Good compensation for hard work.
cons: Trying not to step on the toes of other departments can be difficult sometimes.

review_title: On the brink of excellence, but....
pros: Good sized company with great benefits and opportunity to really make a difference.  Employees have the ability to interact with a variety of disciplines within several service lines.  Many of the employees are there because they feel it is more of a mission than a job.  Well respected within the communities it serves, with tremendous support from those communities as well.  In general, does a good job with the care being provided.
cons: Weak leadership from the top.  CEO does not lead nor does she take a firm/consistent stance on anything.  Does not back her managers, and is obvious about it (front line employees comments about this).  Many of the senior managers are more concerned about not hurting anyone's feelings than they are about running a successful business.  Toxic employees remain because of leadership's lack of action to remove them or at least address the issues.  This company will fail if the leadership does not change.

review_title: Great organization with strong mission focus
pros: Big Bend Hospice is a wonderful community hospice serving Tallahassee and a total of eight counties in that part of the state.  It enjoys tremendous support from the communities it serves and offers a wide variety of patient and family care programs that many other hospices do not.  These include a wonderful (and effective ) music therapy program, extensive adult and children's bereavement support -- available to the entire community, not just family members of patients and much more.  There is a strong feeling of focus on providing the best level of care for the community at all levels of the organization.
cons: Big Bend Hospice is moving past some difficult financial challenges faced several years ago that have limited its ability to offer pay increases for the past two years or so.  This should change in the next few months, but has been a source of frustration for some.

pros: Employees are kind and loving people that care about their patients and the community. Supervisors are understanding and wiling to work through any personal issues or conflicts that arise. Patients and families are mostly very welcoming, warm, and appreciative. It is meaningful and fulfilling work.
cons: Internal conflicts, changes in policies regarding spirituality in the workforce, constant tightening of budgets, salary freezes, no bonuses, audits from medicare---all cause stress and tension in every department. Unfortunately, when I was there chaplains were constantly trying to prove ourselves as worthy of a budget, even though spiritual care is essential and sometimes central to end of life care. .

review_title: Client-focused but very few opportunities for advancement.
pros: Big Bend Hospice, Inc. is an organization that is committed to providing excellent and compassionate care to patients and their loved ones. The individuals with whom I worked were fantastic. Multiple learning and professional development opportunities were provided by the education department.
cons: Salaries and rate of pay were well below national averages. Management was often unresponsive to needs (both felt and expressed) of clinicians and administrative staff. Communication was often reactive, not proactive.

job_title: Hospice RN Case Manager in Tallahassee, FL
pros: Love the flexibility. Love my patients and families. Love the impact and what hospice itself provides to others.
cons: Underpaid. Overworked. High case load. LOTS OF DOCUMENTATION!!!!!

pros: You are given recognition for doing a good job. Friendly work environment. Good management.
cons: The pay is not too good
